meanings.definition: Conglobations: the act or process of forming into a ball or mass.
meanings.sent1: The conglobations of snowflakes created a beautiful snowball.
meanings.sent2: She watched as the conglobations of dough came together to form a perfect cookie.
meanings.sent3: The conglobations of socks in the laundry seemed to have a party of their own.
meanings.sent4: The conglobations of stars in the night sky made her feel small yet connected.
meanings.sent5: The conglobations of colorful balloons at the party made it a festive sight.

meanings.definition: Conglobations: a mass or ball formed by conglobating.
meanings.sent1: He held in his hand a conglobations of rubber bands.
meanings.sent2: The artist sculpted a conglobations of clay into a unique shape.
meanings.sent3: The conglobations of paper balls on the floor made it look like a mini basketball court.
meanings.sent4: The conglobations of clouds in the sky resembled fluffy cotton candy.
meanings.sent5: The conglobations of fallen leaves in the park created a crunchy carpet.

meanings.definition: Conglobations: to form into a ball or mass.
meanings.sent1: She tried to conglobate the clay into a perfect sphere.
meanings.sent2: The chef expertly conglobated the ingredients into a delicious meatball.
meanings.sent3: The children giggled as they tried to conglobate the playdough into different shapes.
meanings.sent4: The artist's hands moved swiftly to conglobate the wire into a stunning sculpture.
meanings.sent5: The snow began to conglobate into large snowballs, ready for a snowball fight.
